sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator uses 1 kW of power to remove 2.5 kJ of heat from its contents every second. Calculate the coefficient of performance of the refrigerator.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the heat removed from the contents (Q_c) to the work input (W) required to remove that heat. Mathematically, it can be expressed as:

COP = Q_c / W

In this problem, the refrigerator removes 2.5 kJ of heat every second (Q_c = 2.5 kJ/s) and uses 1 kW of power (W = 1 kJ/s).

Now, we can calculate the COP:

COP = (2.5 kJ/s) / (1 kJ/s) = 2.5

The coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 2.5.
